title: Moroccan Beef Kebabs
overview: Flavorful Moroccan beef kebabs made with marinated beef porterhouse steak skewers, perfect for a summer BBQ.

ingredients.title: Marinade
content: 750g beef porterhouse steak, trimmed, cut into 3cm pieces

stages.title: Step 1
content: Place fresh coriander, lemon juice, garlic, olive oil, ground coriander, cumin, chilli flakes, and cinnamon in a glass or ceramic bowl.

stages.title: Step 3
content: Add the beef to the bowl and toss to coat evenly. Cover with plastic wrap and marinate in the fridge for 1 hour.

stages.title: Step 4
content: Thread the marinated beef onto bamboo skewers and season with salt and pepper.

stages.title: Step 5
content: Preheat a chargrill or barbecue grill on medium-high. Spray the skewers with oil and cook for 2-3 minutes on each side until the beef is browned and cooked to your liking.

stages.title: Step 6
content: Transfer the kebabs to a plate, cover loosely with foil, and let them rest for 5 minutes before serving.

notes.note: For Moroccan Lamb Kebabs, replace the beef with lamb leg steak and swap fresh coriander for fresh mint.
